full_text: Note 1. Specimens are accepted 9-11 a.m. Monday through Saturday P.P. Glucose samples are accepted till 2.30 p.m. Emergency Electrolytes till 5.30 p.m. Note 2. Reports are given 5-6 p.m. only or after 11 a.m. next day Note 3. More than 12 hrs. overnight fasting condition is required for Triglycerides and Lipid Profile Note 4. 2 ml. blood is required in Fluoride bulb for glucose estimation. Note 5. 2 ml. blood is required in EDTA bulb for Haematology, G-6 P.D; Glycosylated Haemoglobin and Haemoglobin Electrophoresis. Note 6. 8-10 ml. Clotted blood or 4-5 ml. serum is required for Analyzer 26 (SMA 26). Half this quantity is required for all Hormonal tests. Outstation serum samples should be sent in ice for the same. Note 7. False elevation of LDH. Potassium, Iron and Phosphate as well as a false decrease in glucose may be seen if whole blood is received by the lab. Note 8. Bacterial contamination or delayed separation of serum from cells may falsely decrease glucose and may falsely elevate the Potassium, LDH, Phosphate, SGOT and SGPT Note 9. Sedimentation Rate and Platelet results may be affected if the time between specimen drawing and testing is prolonged. Note 10. Hemolyzed serum may falsely elevate Potassium/Iron, SGOT, SGPT, LDH and Phosphate. Note 11. Lipemic serum may falsely elevate Chloride, Alkaline Phosphatase, SGOT, SGPT, Calcium, Total Proteins and Creatinine and may falsely lower the Total Bilirubin. COLLECTION CENTRES 1. Green Park collection time between 0815 hes. to 1030 hrs. Report collection between 7-8 p.m. 2. Swasthya Vihar collection time between 0900 hrs. to 1130 hrs. Report collection between 6-7 p.m. 3. Bhayana Polyclinc, S-565, Greater Kailash (Part II) New Delhi- 110048 collection between 0900 hrs to 1145 hrs. Reports next day same time.
